circumstances: While flying over Louisiana on a flight from Dallas to Haleyville, the right engine failed. Unable to maintain the prescribed altitude, the pilot attempted an emergency landing. The aircraft crash landed in a rough terrain and came to rest. All four occupants escaped uninjured while the aircraft was damaged beyond repair.
probable_cause:
Failure of the right engine in flight. The following factors were reported:
- Engine structure, valve assemblies, material failure,
- The pilot was unable to maintain flying speed, 
- Overload failure, 
- Partial loss of power on one engine, 
- N° 1 cylinder exhaust valve, right engine failed, 
- Pilot unable to maintain single engine flight.
